headline: Major credit card stocks slide after Trump comments on credit card rates
summary: Investing.com -- Major U.S. credit card and payments stocks dipped after President Donald Trump called for a one-year cap on credit card interest rates, reigniting concerns over regulatory risk for the sector.

content.title: Major credit card stocks slide after Trump comments on credit card rates
content.summary: Investing.com -- Major U.S. credit card and payments stocks dipped after President Donald Trump called for a one-year cap on credit card interest rates, reigniting concerns over regulatory risk for the sector.

headline: Citi, JPMorgan, American Express Stocks Drop. Trump’s Credit Card Plan Sparks Panic.
summary: While it’s not clear how Trump may enact his plan, the stocks were getting hit badly in premarket trading Monday.

content.title: Citi, JPMorgan, American Express Stocks Drop. Trump’s Credit Card Plan Sparks Panic.
content.summary: While it’s not clear how Trump may enact his plan, the stocks were getting hit badly in premarket trading Monday.

headline: Capital One, Synchrony Stocks Fall After Trump Calls for Cap on Credit-Card Rates
summary: Stocks in a range of financial companies fell after President Trump called for credit-card interest rates to be capped at 10% for a year, in his latest attempt to address voters' affordability concerns.

content.title: Capital One, Synchrony Stocks Fall After Trump Calls for Cap on Credit-Card Rates
content.summary: Stocks in a range of financial companies fell after President Trump called for credit-card interest rates to be capped at 10% for a year, in his latest attempt to address voters' affordability concerns.

headline: Trump Says Credit Card Firms Violate Law If Rates Not Capped
summary: Trump, speaking Sunday to reporters on Air Force One as he returned to Washington from Florida, doubled down on his demand that card issuers lower interest rates to 10% and keep them there for one year.  “They really abused the credit cards,” he said of major lenders.

content.title: Trump Says Credit Card Firms Violate Law If Rates Not Capped
content.summary: Trump, speaking Sunday to reporters on Air Force One as he returned to Washington from Florida, doubled down on his demand that card issuers lower interest rates to 10% and keep them there for one year.  “They really abused the credit cards,” he said of major lenders.

headline: Barclays, US Bank Shares Slide as Trump Slams Credit Card Rates
summary: The comments increase the political pressure on a slew of card issuers, including Barclays Plc, JPMorgan Chase & Co., Capital One Financial Corp. and Citigroup Inc. Card interest rates — hovering above 20% in recent years — have become a target of US lawmakers on both sides of the aisle, with bills popping up and meeting stiff resistance from the industry.  In pre-market hours in New York, Capital One plunged 10%, while American Express Co. fell 4.9%.

content.title: Barclays, US Bank Shares Slide as Trump Slams Credit Card Rates
content.summary: The comments increase the political pressure on a slew of card issuers, including Barclays Plc, JPMorgan Chase & Co., Capital One Financial Corp. and Citigroup Inc. Card interest rates — hovering above 20% in recent years — have become a target of US lawmakers on both sides of the aisle, with bills popping up and meeting stiff resistance from the industry.  In pre-market hours in New York, Capital One plunged 10%, while American Express Co. fell 4.9%.

headline: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures slide on threat to Fed as DOJ begins criminal probe of Powell
summary: Powell suggested a DOJ subpoena and threats of criminal indictment are a pretext aimed at getting the Fed to cut rates.

content.title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures slide on threat to Fed as DOJ begins criminal probe of Powell
content.summary: Powell suggested a DOJ subpoena and threats of criminal indictment are a pretext aimed at getting the Fed to cut rates.

headline: US Bank Shares Tumble as Trump Slams Credit Card Rates
summary: The comments increase the political pressure on a slew of card issuers, including JPMorgan Chase & Co., Capital One Financial Corp. and Citigroup Inc. Card interest rates — hovering above 20% in recent years — have become a target of US lawmakers on both sides of the aisle, with bills popping up and meeting stiff resistance from the industry.  Mike Mayo, an analyst at Wells Fargo & Co., said in a note that “new potential card cap could wipe out earnings from cards for a year.”

content.title: US Bank Shares Tumble as Trump Slams Credit Card Rates
content.summary: The comments increase the political pressure on a slew of card issuers, including JPMorgan Chase & Co., Capital One Financial Corp. and Citigroup Inc. Card interest rates — hovering above 20% in recent years — have become a target of US lawmakers on both sides of the aisle, with bills popping up and meeting stiff resistance from the industry.  Mike Mayo, an analyst at Wells Fargo & Co., said in a note that “new potential card cap could wipe out earnings from cards for a year.”

headline: Stocks to Watch Monday: Capital One, UnitedHealth, Walmart, Exxon
summary: ↘️ Exxon Mobil (XOM): President Trump said he might block the oil company from drilling in Venezuela after Chief Executive Darren Woods described the country as "uninvestible" at present. Shares dropped about 1% in premarket trading.

headline: Credit card stocks sink after Trump proposes 10% cap on fees: 'Yikes'

summary: President Trump’s call for a cap promises to save Americans billions in interest but also can lead to tightened access to credit.

headline: Affirm stock jumps 3% as Trump’s proposed credit card rate cap sparks shift
summary: Investing.com -- Affirm Holdings (NASDAQ:AFRM) stock rose 3% Monday morning after President Donald Trump called for a one-year cap on credit card interest rates at 10% starting January 20.

content.title: Affirm stock jumps 3% as Trump’s proposed credit card rate cap sparks shift
content.summary: Investing.com -- Affirm Holdings (NASDAQ:AFRM) stock rose 3% Monday morning after President Donald Trump called for a one-year cap on credit card interest rates at 10% starting January 20.

headline: JPMorgan, Capital One Shares Sink on Trump’s Credit-Card Threat
summary: Capital One, the biggest US card issuer, tumbled 7.3% in early New York trading Monday, while JPMorgan, No. 2 in the rankings, dropped 2.2%.  Card interest rates, which have been hovering above 20% in recent years, have been a target of US lawmakers on both sides of the aisle, with bills popping up and meeting stiff resistance from the industry.  Trump, speaking Sunday to reporters, set a Jan. 20 deadline for companies to comply or risk being “in violation of the law.”

content.title: JPMorgan, Capital One Shares Sink on Trump’s Credit-Card Threat
content.summary: Capital One, the biggest US card issuer, tumbled 7.3% in early New York trading Monday, while JPMorgan, No. 2 in the rankings, dropped 2.2%.  Card interest rates, which have been hovering above 20% in recent years, have been a target of US lawmakers on both sides of the aisle, with bills popping up and meeting stiff resistance from the industry.  Trump, speaking Sunday to reporters, set a Jan. 20 deadline for companies to comply or risk being “in violation of the law.”

headline: Stocks Set to Open Lower Amid Fed Fears, U.S. Inflation Data and Big Bank Earnings Awaited
summary: March S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESH26) are down -0.64%, and March Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQH26) are down -0.82% this morning as sentiment took a hit amid escalating tensions between the Trump administration and the Federal Reserve.

content.title: Stocks Set to Open Lower Amid Fed Fears, U.S. Inflation Data and Big Bank Earnings Awaited
content.summary: March S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESH26) are down -0.64%, and March Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQH26) are down -0.82% this morning as sentiment took a hit amid escalating tensions between the Trump administration and the Federal Reserve.
